Postcards From Carrie
Frederick, MD98 contributions
Go for the moose!
Aug 2023 • Family
We went at 5pm after our Grinnell Glacier hike in hopes of seeing a moose and we’re not disappointed. There was a moose in the water when we arrived. There were about 20 people sitting or standing on the banks of the lake taking pictures, and everyone was completely silent as not to disturb the moose. It was so peaceful and there was such a reverence about the scene. When someone did speak it was in a whisper. Such a lovely experience!
Written August 14, 2023
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
Eugenna
Brazil, IN637 contributions
Saw moose 2 out of 3 days
Jul 2022
Easy hike to get to the lake. We literally came here to look for moose. We came 3 different days and we saw moose 2 of the days. One day a bull moose. The other day a female and a young bull who had a "dispute" while we watched.
Written May 8, 2023
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
ArKrWa
135 contributions
No Moose on Our Visit
Aug 2022
We visited between 1-2 hoping to see moose in the lake. No luck!
Quick hike—follow the trail to the Falls and after you go over a bridge, you’ll see an unmarked trail on the left right before a u-shaped tree. Follow the trail to the lake and hope for a moose sighting!
Written August 2, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
dawn c
Ellenville, NY20 contributions
Beautiful !
Jul 2021
This lake is beautiful and on a trail with other lakes and waterfalls. We saw a moose in the lake and her calf was running along the edge of the lake. It was amazing.
Written August 5, 2021
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
The Places Where We Go Podcast
Simi Valley, CA975 contributions
We spotted Moose at this lake
Jun 2021
We opted for a longer hike than just Fishercap Lake, but this was the first main stop on our hike of the day. Easy enough hike for most families. You’ll pass aspen and pine groves along the way. Catch the trailhead just at the end of the Swiftcurrent Motor Inn parking lot (walk to the west end to the start this hike). On our way back from Bullhead Lake later in the day, we passed Fishercap Lake again and spotted Moose bathing in the water in the distance. Quite a beautiful sighting. If you want an easy hike in the area, this is one of your options. If you have more time, continue on to Bullhead Lake (same trail).
Written July 1, 2021
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Atlanta, MI4 contributions
No more moose at Fishercap
Aug 2020
No moose at this lake anymore. Only crowds of people that have caused the moose to leave, according to the ranger.
Written April 28, 2021

Venice, FL2,382 contributions
Easy hike with lots of wildlife
Sep 2019 • Couples
Hiked to Red Rock Falls. 5 miles round trip. Saw moose in Fisher Cap Lake (two different spots), black bear on the trail, mountain goat high up on the rocks at entrance to the falls. Not a hard hike, very beautiful. Take a horn or whistle to ward bears away.
Written April 19, 2020
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

14 contributions
awesome place!
Oct 2019
Easy hike and beautiful!! We were hoping to see some wildlife but did not see any, so we will have to go back another time.
Written November 5, 2019

MaryPat555
Portland, OR3 contributions
Moose!
Aug 2019
We saw 3 females, one with her baby in the lake about 5pm. Very short easy walk from the Swiftcurrent parking lot. After going to Fishercap lake we had the benefit of a Grizzly and a huge Bull Moose on the high hill behind the motel parking lot. Rangers had set up scopes so we got an unbelievable view. It was magical!
Written September 3, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

Corvallis, OR24 contributions
Short hike. Moose!
Aug 2019
A short hike with a good chance of seeing moose if you go in the morning. Don't try to get too close. They are dangerous!
Written August 25, 2019
